channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Reeves refuses to say she will stick to manifesto pledge on tax rises and insists she must face world ‘as it is’ – UK politics live
item.description: Chancellor says she is focused on priorities for British people in pre-budget speech laying ground for expected tax rises Business live: Pound lowest ...

item.title: US elections 2025 live: Donald Trump weighs in as Americans go to the polls in New York City, New Jersey, Virginia and California
item.description: US president says any Jewish person voting for Democratic New York mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani is ‘a stupid person’ NYC mayor elections: how vote...

item.title: Former Met police officer goes on trial accused of sexually abusing a girl
item.description: David Carrick is also alleged to have raped and coercively controlled a woman, Old Bailey is told A former police officer engaged in “predatory and co...

item.title: Dick Cheney, vice-president and giant of Republican politics, dies aged 84
item.description: Cheney, who served under presidents from Nixon to George W Bush, will be remembered for key role after 9/11 Dick Cheney , the divisive US vice-preside...

item.title: Zelenskyy calls for Ukraine to join EU before 2030 after commission delivers warning on corruption - Europe live
item.description: EU says reforms needed ‘with regards to the fundamentals, in particular rule of law’ to have a chance to ‘provisionally close accession negotiations b...

item.title: Polls open in US elections - here are five things to watch
item.description: Though President Donald Trump is not on the ballot, his agenda looms large over the races in New York City, New Jersey, and Virginia.

item.title: More than 50 missed opportunities to stop paedophile head, report finds
item.description: Neil Foden, 68, was jailed for 17 years after being convicted of 19 charges involving four girls.

item.title: Alexander-Arnold mural defaced before Anfield return
item.description: A mural of Trent Alexander-Arnold has been vandalised as the Real Madrid right-back prepares to face former club Liverpool on Tuesday.

item.title: Reeves refuses to rule out tax rises in Budget as she says she will make 'necessary choices'
item.description: The chancellor says she will make 'necessary choices' in an unusual pre-Budget speech.

item.title: British boy who sued parents must stay at Ghana boarding school, judge rules
item.description: The boy, 14 and from London, took his parents to court after they sent him to school in Africa.
